Blocks

Each block takes up the full width of the viewport. A block can contain several sections, depending on the amount of columns/elements a block has been allocated.

All blocks take a minimum of two classes: block and block--[BLOCK-NAME].

The following block names are available to use:

  • block--hero
  • block--single
  • block--double
  • block--triple
  • block--testimonial
  • block--blog

Optionally a block can have a third class indicating the background shading of the section. The background colour will stretch the full width of the viewport.

  • light
  • dark

Hero

A block to be used once on a page, usually at the top.

It contains one h1 element for the page title. The background image is placed using the img tag inside a figure element.

We design, build and support secure automated Azure cloud solutions for Government customers.

<section class="block block--hero">
    <h1>We design, build and support secure automated Azure cloud solutions for Government customers.</h1>
    <figure>
        <img src="assets/images/street-scene.svg" alt="">
    </figure>
</section><!-- .block-hero -->

Single column block

A block containing a single column of content, aligned to the left.

The main classes for each single block are block block--single. Optional classes for the background colour can be light or dark.

Section title

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

    Bullet point explanation. Vestibulum vestibulum odio at finibus rutrum. Curabitur aliquam suscipit libero, quis pretium tellus molestie ac.

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

Single block with a light background.

Single block with a dark background.

<div class="block block--single">
    <section class="column__bullets">
        <h2 class="text__title">Section title</h2>
        <ul class="list-with-checks">
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li>
                <p>Bullet point</p>
                <p>Bullet point explanation. Vestibulum vestibulum odio at finibus rutrum. Curabitur aliquam suscipit libero, quis pretium tellus molestie ac.</p>
            </li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
        </ul>
    </section><!-- .column__bullets -->
</div><!-- .block--single -->


<div class="block block--single light">
    <!-- Column element goes here -->
    <section class="column__text">
        <p>Single block with a light background.</p>    
    </section>
</div><!-- .block--single -->

<div class="block block--single dark">
    <!-- Column element goes here -->
    <section class="column__text">
        <p>Single block with a dark background.</p>
    </section>
</div><!-- .block--single -->

Double column block

A block containing a two columns of content. On narrow viewports the column blocks will tile underneath each other.

The main classes for each double block are block block--double. Optional classes for the background colour can be light or dark.

Section title

Intro paragraph to this section.

Further explainer text if needed can go here. Aenean eget vulputate augue. In hac habitasse platea dictumst.

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

Section title

Double block with a light background.

Double block with a light background.

Section title

Double block with a light background.

Double block with a light background.

<div class="block block--double">
    <section class="column__text">
        <h2 class="text__title">Section title</h2>
        <div class="text__standout">
            <p>Intro paragraph to this section.</p>
        </div>
        <p>Further explainer text if needed can go here. Aenean eget vulputate augue. In hac habitasse platea dictumst.</p>
    </section>
    <section class="column__bullets">
        <ul>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
        </ul>
    </section><!-- .column__bullets -->
</div><!-- .block--double -->


<div class="block block--double light">
    <!-- Two column elements go here -->
    <section class="column__text">
        <h2 class="text__title">Section title</h2>
        <p>Double block with a light background.</p>    
    </section>
    <section class="column__text">
        <p>Double block with a light background.</p>    
    </section>
</div><!-- .block--double -->

<div class="block block--double dark">
    <!-- Two column elements go here -->
    <section class="column__text">
        <h2 class="text__title">Section title</h2>
        <p>Double block with a light background.</p>    
    </section>
    <section class="column__text">
        <p>Double block with a light background.</p>    
    </section>
</div><!-- .block--double -->

Triple column block

A block containing a three columns of content. On narrow viewports the column blocks will tile to two columns and then underneath each other.

The main classes for each triple block are block block--triple.

Suitable section element for this block are:

  • section icon with bullets
  • section icon with checks
  • section icon with text

Column title

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

Column title

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

Column title

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

<div class="block block--triple">
    <section class="column__icon">
        <img class="svg__icon" src="assets/images/icon-management.svg" alt="">
        <h2 class="text__title">Column title</h2>
        <ul>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
        </ul>
    </section>
    <section class="column__icon">
        <img class="svg__icon" src="assets/images/icon-management.svg" alt="">
        <h2 class="text__title">Column title</h2>
        <ul>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
        </ul>
    </section>
    <section class="column__icon">
        <img class="svg__icon" src="assets/images/icon-management.svg" alt="">
        <h2 class="text__title">Column title</h2>
        <ul>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
            <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
        </ul>
    </section>
</div><!-- .block--triple -->

Testimonial

A block for a client testimonial. The text is centred inside the block.

The main classes for this block are block block--testimonial. An optional class for the background colour can be dark.

Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.

Julius Ceasar, Emperor

Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.

Julius Ceasar, Emperor 
<div class="block block--testimonial">
    <blockquote>
        <p>Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.</p>
        <cite class="capitals">Julius Ceasar, Emperor</cite>
    </blockquote>
</div><!-- .block-testimonial -->


<div class="block block--testimonial dark">
    <blockquote>
        <p>Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.</p>
        <cite class="capitals">Julius Ceasar, Emperor</cite>
    </blockquote>
</div><!-- .block-testimonial -->

Blog excerpt

Similar to the double column block, this block also contains two elements. They will tile underneath each other on narrow viewports.

The main classes for each block are block block--blog block--double.

Month 99, YEAR

Blog post title

First paragraph of the blog post. Etiam dictum, dui ut viverra ullamcorper, ipsum dolor ultrices libero, vitae venenatis dolor risus id metus.

Read more

Month 99, YEAR

Blog post title

First paragraph of the blog post. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis.

Read more

<div class="block block--blog block--double">
    <article class="blog__excerpt">
        <time>Month 99, YEAR</time>
        <h2 class="post__title"><a href="#" rel="bookmark">Blog post title</a></h2>        
        <p>First paragraph of the blog post. Etiam dictum, dui ut viverra ullamcorper, ipsum dolor ultrices libero, vitae venenatis dolor risus id metus.</p>
        <p><a class="post__link" href="#" rel="bookmark">Read more</a></p>
    </article>
    <article class="blog__excerpt">
        <time>Month 99, YEAR</time>
        <h2 class="post__title"><a href="#" rel="bookmark">Blog post title</a></h2>
        <p>First paragraph of the blog post. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis.</p>
        <p><a class="post__link" href="#" rel="bookmark">Read more</a></p>
    </article>
</div><!-- .block--blog -->

Blog post

A block containing a single column of content, aligned to the left.

The main classes for this block are block block--blog.

For the Share This section you will need to replace [__PAGE_TITLE__], [__PAGE_URL__] and [__PAGE_EXCERPT__] with the appropriate content.

Month 99, YEAR

Blog post title

Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti. Suspendisse est nibh, congue sed porta eget, pulvinar ut tortor. Ut pulvinar purus eget justo eleifend, sed tincidunt ipsum ultricies.

Etiam dictum, dui ut viverra ullamcorper, ipsum dolor ultrices libero, vitae venenatis dolor risus id metus...

Share this

  • Twitter
  • LinkedIn
  • Email 
<div class="block block--blog">
    <article class="blog__post">
        <time>Month 99, YEAR</time>
        <h1 class="post__title">Blog post title</h1>
        <p>Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti. Suspendisse est nibh, congue sed porta eget, pulvinar ut tortor. Ut pulvinar purus eget justo eleifend, sed tincidunt ipsum ultricies.</p>
        <p>Etiam dictum, dui ut viverra ullamcorper, ipsum dolor ultrices libero, vitae venenatis dolor risus id metus...</p>
        <footer class="post__share">
            <h4>Share this</h4>
            <ul>
            	<li>
            		<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=[__PAGE_URL__]&amp;text=[__PAGE_TITLE__]" rel="external">
            		   	<span class="screen-reader-text">Twitter</span>
            			<svg class="svg__icon"><use xlink:href="#twitter" /></svg>
            		</a>
            	</li>
                <li>
                    <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?url=[__PAGE_URL__]&title=[__PAGE_TITLE__]">
            		   	<span class="screen-reader-text">LinkedIn</span>
            			<svg class="svg__icon"><use xlink:href="#linkedin" /></svg>
            		</a>
            	</li>
            	<li>
            		<a href="mailto:?subject=[__PAGE_TITLE__]&amp;body=[__PAGE_URL__][__PAGE_EXCERPT__]">
            		   	<span class="screen-reader-text">Email</span>
            			<svg class="svg__icon"><use xlink:href="#email" /></svg>
            		</a>
            	</li>    
            </ul>
        </footer><!-- .post__share -->    
        
    </article>
    
</div><!-- .block--blog -->
